Major Requirements: A total of 65 hours in theatre arts, including 4 hours of THEA 1095 or 4095 (minimum of 2 hours of 4095); 3 hours of THEA 2700; 4 hours of THEA 4400; THEA 1043, 1045, 1046, 1700, 2300, 2380 and 2440; 3 hours from THEA 3100, 3280, 3400, 4240 or 4460; 6 hours from THEA 2110, 2150 or 2160; THEA 3150, 3160, 3170, 3180 and 4350; 9 hours, after consultation with an adviser, from THEA 3190, 4110 or 4500 (may be repeated for credit)., 4631=A minor in theatre consists of 21 semester hours: 9 hours from THEA 1043, 1045, 1046, 2051, 2110, 2150, 2160, 2350, 2351, or 2380; plus 12 advanced hours in theatre., 19619=2. Course and Subject Guide All Courses of Instruction are located in one section at the back of this catalog. Courses of Instruction The serious student of dance or theatre may become a member of Alpha Psi Omega, Chi Tau Epsilon, DANCE UNiT and University Players, undergraduate and graduate organizations that serve the dance and theatre department and suggested four-year degree plan. Students are encouraged to see their adviser each semester for help with program decisions and enrollment. Students are responsible for meeting all course prerequisites. Following is
